action.action-desc: Mr. Risch (for himself, Mr. Crapo, Mr. Ricketts, Mr. Cruz, Mr. Sheehy, Mr. Scott of Florida, and Ms. Lummis) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To require agencies submit zero-based budgets.

paragraph.text: The term agency has the meaning given the term in section 551 of title 5, United States Code.
The term zero-based budget means a systematic budget analysis in support of decision making in which managersâ€”

subparagraph.text: examine current objectives, operations, and costs;
consider alternative ways of carrying out a program or activity; and
rank different programs or activities by order of importance to the organization.

subsection.text: Every sixth year, each agency shall submit to the Director of the Office of Management and Budget and the Committee on the Budget of the Senate and the Committee on the Budget of the House of Representatives a zero-based budget for the next fiscal year and each of the 4 ensuing fiscal years.

In addition to the zero-based budget required under subsection (b), each agency, except the Department of Defense and the National Nuclear Security Administration shall submit recommendations for which programs Congress should cut or reduce appropriations in an amount that equals not less than a 2-percent reduction from the previous year appropriation in discretionary spending.
